intro: Marrubium heterodon, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are rough and hairy, with a distinctive grayish-green color, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Marrubium heterodon is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
